snippet: The bone disease, resulting from vitamin D deficiency and typically associated with the inferior diet and living conditions of the poor, may have been a consequence of the family’s vast wealth.
abstract: Study in International Journal of Osteoarchaeology suggests that children of the Medicis, one of history's wealthiest families, may have had rickets, based on examination of skeletons of nine 16th-century Medici children; disease, caused by lack of vitamin D, is normally associated with poverty, but diet and coddled indoor existence of Medicis may have been to blame.
lead_paragraph: The bone disease, resulting from vitamin D deficiency and typically associated with the inferior diet and living conditions of the poor, may have been a consequence of the family’s vast wealth.

headline.main: Rickets Plagued Children of the Medicis
headline.print_headline: Archeology: Rickets Plagued Children of the Medicis
